intro: Gastrochilus septatus, commonly known as the seven-lobed orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive flowers, which feature seven prominent lobes on the lip, giving it its scientific name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree bark in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its humid environment. The orchid blooms during the rainy season, producing fragrant, colorful flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
